headline.main: LETTERS ON THE CHARITIES OF ENGLAND.; THE LONDON LODGING-HOUSES. NUMBER FOUR.

docs.lead_paragraph: The next visit, in our night journey, after the one described in my last letter, was to a house in a dark street, where, as our officer said, a few years ago no policeman could safely go at night without arms and a comrade. As we came near the door he whispered to us, "Look about you--this is the coiners' and thieves' 'ouse--say nothing."

headline.main: MISCELLANEOUS EXTRACTS.; FROM OUR FOREIGN FILES.

docs.lead_paragraph: French Police. From Galignami's Messenger. A little man, of rather grotesque appearance, named Perchet, appeared on Saturday before the Tribunal of Correctional Police to complain of his wife for unfaithfulness to him. The wife is a tall strapping woman with fine eyes, and is of very bold bearing; the husband on the contrary seemed timid in the extreme, and spoke in a slight shrill voice.

headline.main: THE KANSAS SETTLEMENT.; Interesting Account of the Massachusetts Emigration Company.

docs.lead_paragraph: The persons who accompanied the first party of the Massachusetts Emigration Company to Kansas have returned, and made a favorable report of the expedition, and a new party is now about starting to join the colony.
docs.snippet: The persons who accompanied the first party of the Massachusetts Emigration Company to Kansas have returned, and made a favorable report of the expedition, and a new party is now about starting to join the colony.

docs.lead_paragraph: The deaths this morning, up to 1 o'clock, numbered seven, and there were thirteen new cases. The total deaths to this time are 84, and 40 cases are still under treatment. Trains between Lancaster and Harrisburg and Columbia have ceased running.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; Meeting of the Vegetarlan Society.

docs.lead_paragraph: The regular monthly meeting of the Vegetarian Society was held on Tuesday evening at the Laight-street Lyceum. Dr. TRALL Presided, and introduced the father of Vegetarianism in this country, Rev. Dr. METCALFE, of Philadelphia, who state that he had practiced Vegetarian diet, and abstained from all fish, flesh and fowl ever since 1809. ad been

docs.lead_paragraph: Hon. AMASA WALKER, late Secretary of the State of Massachusetts, has delivered a lecture before the Commercial and Nautical Lastitute of Boston, upon the subject of Wages. We extract portions of it: NOMINAL AND REAL WAGES. There is often a considerable difference between nominal and real wages, or between the wages of the employe when reckoned in money, or when realized in such commodities as his wants require.

docs.lead_paragraph: The July mail from the United States arrived at Santa Fe on the 23d of that month, without having any accident on the way. Gov MERRIWETHER, on his return from the United States, arrived at Santa Fe on the 22d July, in good health and spirits. He was accompanied by his son, Mr. RAYMOND MERRIWETHER, and Dr. STECK, the newly appointed Indian agent, in the room of Mr. SMITH, deceased.

headline.main: ONE WEEK LATER FROM EUROPE; ARRIVAL OF THE NIAGARA AT HALIFAX. ARRIVAL OF THE ST. LOUIS AT THIS PORT. The Crimean Expedition to Sail on the 20th August. DEFEAT OF THE TURKS NOT CONFIRMED. Russia Refuses the Austrian Invitation to Negotiate. Highly Interesting from Bomarsund and the Aland Islands. Their Fortifications Dismantled and Abandoned. SWEDEN REFUSES THEM AS A GIFT. THE CHOLERA STILL RAGING. TROOPS UNFIT FOR SERVICE. Affairs in Spain. Queen Christina's Property Confiscated and she Expelled from the Country. RESIGNATION OF THE BELGIAN MINISTRY. BAD NEWS FROM THE VINTAGES. FINE HARVEST. Corn Markets Depressed--Cotton Improved. NEWS BY THE NIAGARA.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Cunard Steamship Niagara, from Liverpool, at 2 P.M. on Saturday, the 2d inst., has just arrived at this port. The screw steamship City of Philadelphia sailed from Liverpool for Philadelphia on the afternoon of the 30th ult. a on the afternoon of the 30th ult.

headline.main: ARRIVAL OF THE EMPIRE CITY.; $1,086,786 IN SPECLE. LATER FROM THE ISTHMUS. THE OHINESE NEWS. LATER FROM SOUTH AMERICA AND AUSTRALIA.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Empire City mail steamship, Capt WM. RATHBUN, arrived Tuesday morning in 9 days 20 hours from Aspinwall, with treasure, mails and passingers from steamship Oregon, which left San Francisco Aug. 16. The Empire City brings $1,086,786 54 in treasure, and 200 passengers.
